com.vdom.comms

Class Comms

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vdom.comms.Comms

  • public class Comms
extends java.lang.Object
    Ok, I reworked this class a little. Originally, this was a class for a hybrid between asynchronous and event-driven communication. One could communicate using public get and put asynchronously and / or run this class as a thread. Now this class spawn a thread upon creation and communicate with it in a threadsafe manner. Use doWait() in place of get(); put() keeps its functionality.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Comms

        public Comms(EventHandler parent,
     int port)
      throws java.io.IOException
        Initialize this as server. This starts the network thread, which does the initialization of the socket and starts listening. This also waits until the network thread is done initializing and throws an error. TODO: This could block if the socket initialization takes long (does that happen?)
        Parameters:
        parent - In the example it's the VDomServer object
        port -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • Comms

     java.lang.String host,
     int port)
      throws java.io.StreamCorruptedException,
             java.io.IOException,
             java.net.UnknownHostException
        Initialize as client This starts the network thread, which does the initialization of the socket and connects. TODO: Do callers rely on the socket being connected as soon as this returns?
        Parameters:
        parent - (GameActivity)
        host -
        port -
        Throws:
        java.io.StreamCorruptedException
        java.io.IOException
        java.net.UnknownHostException

        public Event doWaitTimeout(long timeout)
        Returns the latest Event or null if none received within timeout
        Parameters:
        timeout - in milliseconds. May be 0 if we don't wait (poll), or negative for infinite wait
